personalInfo.name: NEEL MULAY
personalInfo.title: MS Mechanical Engineering graduate student with expertise in robotics, mechatronics, and multidisciplinary problem-solving

education.description: I thrive in fast-paced, collaborative environments, leveraging my leadership skills and technical expertise to drive innovation. My diverse skill set and passion for innovation in robotics and mechatronics position me as a valuable asset for cutting-edge research and development in advanced robotics, smart materials and mechanical systems.

education.school: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
education.description: Focus on mechanical design and robotics

experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experience.company: General Robotics, Automation, Sensing, & Perception Lab

experience.title: Undergraduate Researcher
experience.location: Czech Academy of Sciences, Prague, CZ

projects.title: Robot Battle Arena
projects.description: Developed a versatile robot capable of operating in various modes including manual control, autonomous wall-following, and attack mode, highlighting adaptability in robotics programming and system design.

projects.title: F1/10 Autonomous Racing
projects.description: Developing and optimizing an autonomous 1:10 scale Formula 1 race car using ROS2 and state-of-the-art autonomous driving techniques.

projects.title: Pick and Place with Robot Arm
projects.description: Implemented inverse kinematics algorithms for precise control of a robotic arm, enabling accurate block detection, pick-up, and stacking in both static and dynamic environments.

projects.title: Fast Car
projects.description: Constructed a robot using MDF panel base with DC motors, integrated encoders, and wheels with a WiFi-based control system.

projects.title: Dancing Man
projects.description: Designed and implemented a 3-DOF interactive input and output device that mimics a dancer.

projects.title: Sensors Lab
projects.description: Designed and implemented various digital logic and sensing systems, showcasing skills in microcontroller programming, circuit design, and signal processing.

projects.title: Trajectory Optimization for 7-DOF Arm
projects.description: Implemented and compared two path planning algorithms for a robotic arm: Rapidly-exploring Random Trees (RRT) and Potential Field methods.

projects.title: Characterization of NiTi wires
projects.description: Conducted an in-depth study on the thermomechanical properties of Nickel-Titanium (NiTi) shape memory alloy wires for actuator applications.

projects.title: Composite Analysis & Modeling
projects.description: Conducted an analysis of temperature-dependent properties of fiber-reinforced composites using predictive models.
